Some people who earn enough to qualify for meager or no subsidies find health care unaffordable. It will probably take many more years before it is clear whether the law has been beneficial to public health.

Congressional Budget Office says millions may lose coverage next year if Congress does not repeal Obamacare. Julian Zelizer: CBO’s estimating models seem impervious to reality. In the real world, the Obamacare exchanges are in crisis, he says, and consumers struggle with rising premiums and cost-sharing requirements. Zelizer says the GOP bill retains existing subsidies and Medicaid expansion through 2019.CBO’s estimates of the effects of the GOP bill are deeply flawed. They begin with rosy assumptions about the current law, writes Julian Zelizer. Congress should set policy based on reality, not on CBO's speculations, he says. Zelizer: Obamacare exchanges are falling apart, Medicaid spending is growing at an excessive pace.

Illinois consumers likely face staggering price hikes for individual insurance policies. Some types of plans could cost an average of 43 percent to 55 percent more. A first tranche of states approved 2017 rates with similarly cardiac-arrest-inducing premium increases. Many consumers will find fewer choices because major carriers fled this market.Instead of gearing subsidies to incomes, let Americans not covered via an employer reap tax credits to help finance their insurance purchases on the open market. Imagine the pricing competition that would unleash. We can deny the current system's failings, or we can parlay our evolving knowledge into something much better.

Some suggest that the calls for repealing Obamacare are fading. John Avlon: Maybe, but don’t count on it. He says Obamacare is working extremely well and is insulating itself from repeal.Avlon: But the success of the ACA strikes at the heart of dysfunction employed by conservatives.When government messes up, when it shuts down, the winners are those who can say: “See? We told you. Government’s broken!” Never mind that those making that case are the ones doing the breaking. The more we elevate that case, the closer we get to the road back to Factville.
